medical_history.history_of_present_illness: The patient reports that the abdominal pain began approximately 3 hours after eating a fatty meal the day prior to presentation. She has had persistent pain since then, described as epigastric with radiation to the right upper quadrant (RUQ) and back. The pain is associated with nausea and 3 episodes of non-bilious non-bloody emesis. The patient reports similar episodes of pain when eating fatty foods for the past month, which were less severe and self-resolved. Denies chest pain, dyspnea, or cough.
medical_history.family_history: No history of gallstones or pancreatic cancer
